is an important source of water for farming, cities, and electrical power production. Major man-made reservoirs on

include Lake Marble Falls, Lake Buchanan, Inks Lake, Lake LBJ, Lake Travis, Lake Austin, and Town Lake in Austin. Collectively, these lakes are known as the Highland Lakes. In addition to power plants operating on each of the major lakes, waters of
are used for cooling the South Texas Nuclear Project, near Bay City.
